                window.pageLevelData.faqSection = {"sectionId":null,"header":"Frequently Asked Questions","itemList":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":{"title":"What is eSIM?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"An eSIM is a digital SIM that eliminates the need for a physical SIM card. With eSIM, you can quickly and easily transfer an existing cellular plan or get a new cellular plan, all digitally. You can even store multiple eSIMs on the same device and use two phone numbers at the same time. And it’s more secure — someone can’t remove the physical SIM card if your iPhone is lost or stolen. In just a few simple steps, you are ready to make calls, send messages, and browse the web. <a href=\"https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212780\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: support.apple.com/kb/HT212780\" target=\"_blank\">Learn more about eSIM.<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>  \n<br />\n<br />\nUse of eSIM requires a wireless service plan. Not all carriers support eSIM. Use of eSIM in iPhone may be disabled when purchased from some carriers. Check with your carrier for details and restrictions. <a href=\"https://support.apple.com/kb/HT209096\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: support.apple.com/kb/HT209096\" target=\"_blank\">Learn more about eSIM and carriers.<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a> ","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":false},{"index":1,"value":{"title":"Can I activate an iPhone 15 outside of the United States?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"iPhone 15 models purchased in the U.S. or Puerto Rico don’t have a physical SIM tray and activate only using eSIM. You can activate your iPhone outside the country if your carrier supports eSIM. <a href=\"http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213448\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: support.apple.com/en-us/HT213448\" target=\"_blank\">Learn more<span class=\"a11y\"> (Opens in a new window)</span></a> about using eSIM while traveling.","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":2,"first":false,"even":false,"last":false},{"index":2,"value":{"title":"Will my new iPhone be unlocked?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"In most cases, yes. An iPhone purchased from <a href=\"http://apple.com\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: apple.com\" target=\"_blank\">apple.com<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a> is unlocked. Once your new iPhone is activated, it remains unlocked, which means you can use it with any network that provides service for iPhone. However, if you buy an iPhone with an AT&T Installment Plan, your iPhone will be locked to AT&T and will only work on the AT&T network for the term of your Installment Plan agreement.","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":3,"first":false,"even":true,"last":false},{"index":3,"value":{"title":"When I buy from apple.com, does my iPhone come ready to use?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"<p>\n\tCarrier-connected iPhone 15, iPhone 16e, iPhone 16, and iPhone 16 Pro models will arrive ready to activate with eSIM and can connect to your cellular voice and data service without a physical SIM card.\n</p>\n<p>\n\tIf you completed the steps to authorize activation with AT&T, Boost Mobile, T-Mobile, or Verizon when you purchased your new iPhone online, it will arrive ready to use. Just turn it on and follow the onscreen instructions to set it up and activate with the carrier. To activate with eSIM, you will need Wi-Fi for setup.\n</p>\n<p>\n\tIf you choose “Connect to a carrier later” when you buy your iPhone, you can activate with your service when you receive your device. If you’re asked to transfer your SIM, follow the onscreen instructions to transfer service from your previous iPhone. To learn more, visit <a href=\"http://support.apple.com/kb/HT212780\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: support.apple.com/kb/HT212780\" target=\"_blank\">support.apple.com/kb/HT212780<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>.\n</p>","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":4,"first":false,"even":false,"last":false},{"index":4,"value":{"title":"Will my iPhone work worldwide?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"<p>All iPhone models are world phones, so you can use them almost anywhere. Whether you are a GSM or CDMA network customer, you can roam internationally on GSM networks in over 200 countries or regions around the world. If you financed your iPhone with your wireless carrier, contact them to verify that you can roam internationally. </p>\n\n<p>Availability of 5G and LTE data varies in some countries or regions and depends on carrier support for certain 5G and LTE radio frequencies. Contact your wireless carrier for more information regarding international roaming policies and rates.</p>\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.apple.com/iphone/LTE\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: iphone/LTE\" class=\"icon icon-after icon-external\" target=\"_blank\">Information on iPhone support for 5G and LTE<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a></p>","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":5,"first":false,"even":true,"last":false},{"index":5,"value":{"title":"I’m buying an iPhone as a gift. Can it be activated at a later date?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"In most cases, an iPhone purchased from apple.com can be activated later. However, certain special deals or discounts may require preparation with the carrier at the time of purchase so that the phone arrives ready to use.","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":6,"first":false,"even":false,"last":false},{"index":6,"value":{"title":"Is it easy to transfer my data and set up my new iPhone?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"<p>Yes, iCloud makes moving your settings, photos, apps, and documents to a new device seamless. Just sign in to iCloud when you set up your new device, access your previous device’s iCloud backup, and you’ll be ready to go in minutes.</p>\n<p>Don’t have enough iCloud storage to complete a backup? iCloud will grant you enough temporary storage to make sure you can back up your device and get all your data transferred, free of charge (iOS 15 required).<p>\n<p>With Quick Start, you can restore your data and content to your new iPhone from your iCloud backup. For phones using iOS 12.4 or later, Quick Start offers the option of using device-to-device migration, allowing you to transfer all your data wirelessly from your current device to your new one.<p>\n<p>If you are switching from Android, you need to download the Move to iOS app first and follow the setup process on your new iPhone.</p>\n<p>To learn how to transfer data to your new iPhone, see <a href=\"http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201269\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: support.apple.com/en-us/HT201269\" target=\"_blank\">support.apple.com/en-us/HT201269</a>.<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></p></p></p></p></p>","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":7,"first":false,"even":true,"last":false},{"index":7,"value":{"title":"Are there differences between an iPhone for AT&T, Boost Mobile, T-Mobile, or Verizon?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"The iPhone models for AT&T, Boost Mobile, T-Mobile, and Verizon are the same. If you choose to pay with an AT&T Installment Plan, your iPhone will be locked to the carrier. If you pay with Boost Mobile Financing, it will be locked to the carrier for the first 60 days. For details on network support, please see <a href=\"http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204039\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: support.apple.com/en-us/HT204039\" target=\"_blank\">support.apple.com/en-us/HT204039<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>.","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":8,"first":false,"even":false,"last":false},{"index":8,"value":{"title":"","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":9,"first":false,"even":true,"last":false},{"index":9,"value":{"title":"What are connectivity discounts?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"Connectivity discounts are reflected in the advertised price of select iPhone models, and are available to customers who connect with select carriers at the time of purchase. The discount is not available for customers who choose to connect to a carrier later.","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":10,"first":false,"even":false,"last":false},{"index":10,"value":{"title":"Which network providers offer 5G service?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"<p>\n\tAT&T, Boost Mobile, T-Mobile, and Verizon are the national wireless carriers for iPhone in the United States, and they all offer 5G service. iPhone 15, iPhone 16e, iPhone 16, and iPhone 16 Pro are 5G capable. The Apple Store and <a href=\"http://www.apple.com\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: www.apple.com\" target=\"_blank\">apple.com<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a> sell these models for use on these networks.\n</p>\n<p>\n\t<a href=\"http://www.att.com/5g/coverage-map\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: www.att.com/5g/coverage-map\" class=\"icon icon-after icon-external\" target=\"_blank\">View the AT&T 5G coverage map<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>\n</p>\n<p>\n\t<a href=\"http://www.boostmobile.com/coveragemap_xp\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: www.boostmobile.com/coveragemap_xp\" class=\"icon icon-after icon-external\" target=\"_blank\">View the Boost Mobile 5G coverage map<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>\n</p>\n<p>\n\t<a href=\"http://www.t-mobile.com/coverage/coverage-map\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: www.t-mobile.com/coverage/coverage-map\" class=\"icon icon-after icon-external\" target=\"_blank\">View the T‑Mobile 5G coverage map<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>\n</p>\n<p>\n\t<a href=\"http://verizon.com/5g/coverage-map\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: verizon.com/5g/coverage-map\" class=\"icon icon-after icon-external\" target=\"_blank\">View the Verizon 5G coverage map<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>\n</p>","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":11,"first":false,"even":true,"last":false},{"index":11,"value":{"title":"Can I return my iPhone?","descriptionData":{"items":[{"index":0,"value":"<p>Yes. If you change your mind and no longer wish to keep your iPhone, you have the option to return it to us. The returned iPhone must be in good condition and in the original packaging, which contains all accessories, manuals, and instructions. Returns are subject to Apple’s Sales and Refunds Policy.</p>\n\n<p><div class=\"dd-compact-right-small-3\"><a href=\"/shop/help/returns_refund\" data-slot-name=\"faqSection\" data-feature-name=\"Astro Link\" data-display-name=\"AOS: help/returns_refund\" class=\"icon icon-after icon-external\" target=\"_blank\">Learn more about returns, refunds, and exchanges<span class=\"visuallyhidden\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a></div></p>","position":1,"first":true,"even":true,"last":true}],"size":1}},"position":12,"first":false,"even":false,"last":true}],"size":12},"footer":null,"isDefaultOpen":true,"pageId":"iphone_15","faqString":"{\"sectionId\":null,\"header\":\"Frequently Asked Questions\",\"itemList\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":{\"title\":\"What is eSIM?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"An eSIM is a digital SIM that eliminates the need for a physical SIM card. With eSIM, you can quickly and easily transfer an existing cellular plan or get a new cellular plan, all digitally. You can even store multiple eSIMs on the same device and use two phone numbers at the same time. And it’s more secure — someone can’t remove the physical SIM card if your iPhone is lost or stolen. In just a few simple steps, you are ready to make calls, send messages, and browse the web. <a href=\\\"https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212780\\\" data-slot-name=\\\"faqSection\\\" data-feature-name=\\\"Astro Link\\\" data-display-name=\\\"AOS: support.apple.com/kb/HT212780\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Learn more about eSIM.<span class=\\\"visuallyhidden\\\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>  \\n<br />\\n<br />\\nUse of eSIM requires a wireless service plan. Not all carriers support eSIM. Use of eSIM in iPhone may be disabled when purchased from some carriers. Check with your carrier for details and restrictions. <a href=\\\"https://support.apple.com/kb/HT209096\\\" data-slot-name=\\\"faqSection\\\" data-feature-name=\\\"Astro Link\\\" data-display-name=\\\"AOS: support.apple.com/kb/HT209096\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Learn more about eSIM and carriers.<span class=\\\"visuallyhidden\\\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a> \",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":false},{\"index\":1,\"value\":{\"title\":\"Can I activate an iPhone 15 outside of the United States?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"iPhone 15 models purchased in the U.S. or Puerto Rico don’t have a physical SIM tray and activate only using eSIM. You can activate your iPhone outside the country if your carrier supports eSIM. <a href=\\\"http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213448\\\" data-slot-name=\\\"faqSection\\\" data-feature-name=\\\"Astro Link\\\" data-display-name=\\\"AOS: support.apple.com/en-us/HT213448\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Learn more<span class=\\\"a11y\\\"> (Opens in a new window)</span></a> about using eSIM while traveling.\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":2,\"first\":false,\"even\":false,\"last\":false},{\"index\":2,\"value\":{\"title\":\"Will my new iPhone be unlocked?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"In most cases, yes. An iPhone purchased from <a href=\\\"http://apple.com\\\" data-slot-name=\\\"faqSection\\\" data-feature-name=\\\"Astro Link\\\" data-display-name=\\\"AOS: apple.com\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">apple.com<span class=\\\"visuallyhidden\\\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a> is unlocked. Once your new iPhone is activated, it remains unlocked, which means you can use it with any network that provides service for iPhone. However, if you buy an iPhone with an AT&T Installment Plan, your iPhone will be locked to AT&T and will only work on the AT&T network for the term of your Installment Plan agreement.\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":3,\"first\":false,\"even\":true,\"last\":false},{\"index\":3,\"value\":{\"title\":\"When I buy from apple.com, does my iPhone come ready to use?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"<p>\\n\\tCarrier-connected iPhone 15, iPhone 16e, iPhone 16, and iPhone 16 Pro models will arrive ready to activate with eSIM and can connect to your cellular voice and data service without a physical SIM card.\\n</p>\\n<p>\\n\\tIf you completed the steps to authorize activation with AT&T, Boost Mobile, T-Mobile, or Verizon when you purchased your new iPhone online, it will arrive ready to use. Just turn it on and follow the onscreen instructions to set it up and activate with the carrier. To activate with eSIM, you will need Wi-Fi for setup.\\n</p>\\n<p>\\n\\tIf you choose “Connect to a carrier later” when you buy your iPhone, you can activate with your service when you receive your device. If you’re asked to transfer your SIM, follow the onscreen instructions to transfer service from your previous iPhone. To learn more, visit <a href=\\\"http://support.apple.com/kb/HT212780\\\" data-slot-name=\\\"faqSection\\\" data-feature-name=\\\"Astro Link\\\" data-display-name=\\\"AOS: support.apple.com/kb/HT212780\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">support.apple.com/kb/HT212780<span class=\\\"visuallyhidden\\\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>.\\n</p>\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":4,\"first\":false,\"even\":false,\"last\":false},{\"index\":4,\"value\":{\"title\":\"Will my iPhone work worldwide?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"<p>All iPhone models are world phones, so you can use them almost anywhere. Whether you are a GSM or CDMA network customer, you can roam internationally on GSM networks in over 200 countries or regions around the world. If you financed your iPhone with your wireless carrier, contact them to verify that you can roam internationally. </p>\\n\\n<p>Availability of 5G and LTE data varies in some countries or regions and depends on carrier support for certain 5G and LTE radio frequencies. Contact your wireless carrier for more information regarding international roaming policies and rates.</p>\\n\\n<p><a href=\\\"https://www.apple.com/iphone/LTE\\\" data-slot-name=\\\"faqSection\\\" data-feature-name=\\\"Astro Link\\\" data-display-name=\\\"AOS: iphone/LTE\\\" class=\\\"icon icon-after icon-external\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Information on iPhone support for 5G and LTE<span class=\\\"visuallyhidden\\\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a></p>\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":5,\"first\":false,\"even\":true,\"last\":false},{\"index\":5,\"value\":{\"title\":\"I’m buying an iPhone as a gift. Can it be activated at a later date?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"In most cases, an iPhone purchased from apple.com can be activated later. However, certain special deals or discounts may require preparation with the carrier at the time of purchase so that the phone arrives ready to use.\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":6,\"first\":false,\"even\":false,\"last\":false},{\"index\":6,\"value\":{\"title\":\"Is it easy to transfer my data and set up my new iPhone?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"<p>Yes, iCloud makes moving your settings, photos, apps, and documents to a new device seamless. Just sign in to iCloud when you set up your new device, access your previous device’s iCloud backup, and you’ll be ready to go in minutes.</p>\\n<p>Don’t have enough iCloud storage to complete a backup? iCloud will grant you enough temporary storage to make sure you can back up your device and get all your data transferred, free of charge (iOS 15 required).<p>\\n<p>With Quick Start, you can restore your data and content to your new iPhone from your iCloud backup. For phones using iOS 12.4 or later, Quick Start offers the option of using device-to-device migration, allowing you to transfer all your data wirelessly from your current device to your new one.<p>\\n<p>If you are switching from Android, you need to download the Move to iOS app first and follow the setup process on your new iPhone.</p>\\n<p>To learn how to transfer data to your new iPhone, see <a href=\\\"http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201269\\\" data-slot-name=\\\"faqSection\\\" data-feature-name=\\\"Astro Link\\\" data-display-name=\\\"AOS: support.apple.com/en-us/HT201269\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">support.apple.com/en-us/HT201269</a>.<span class=\\\"visuallyhidden\\\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></p></p></p></p></p>\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":7,\"first\":false,\"even\":true,\"last\":false},{\"index\":7,\"value\":{\"title\":\"Are there differences between an iPhone for AT&T, Boost Mobile, T-Mobile, or Verizon?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"The iPhone models for AT&T, Boost Mobile, T-Mobile, and Verizon are the same. If you choose to pay with an AT&T Installment Plan, your iPhone will be locked to the carrier. If you pay with Boost Mobile Financing, it will be locked to the carrier for the first 60 days. For details on network support, please see <a href=\\\"http://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204039\\\" data-slot-name=\\\"faqSection\\\" data-feature-name=\\\"Astro Link\\\" data-display-name=\\\"AOS: support.apple.com/en-us/HT204039\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">support.apple.com/en-us/HT204039<span class=\\\"visuallyhidden\\\"> (Opens in a new window) </span></a>.\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":8,\"first\":false,\"even\":false,\"last\":false},{\"index\":8,\"value\":{\"title\":\"\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":9,\"first\":false,\"even\":true,\"last\":false},{\"index\":9,\"value\":{\"title\":\"What are connectivity discounts?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"Connectivity discounts are reflected in the advertised price of select iPhone models, and are available to customers who connect with select carriers at the time of purchase. The discount is not available for customers who choose to connect to a carrier later.\",\"position\":1,\"first\":true,\"even\":true,\"last\":true}],\"size\":1}},\"position\":10,\"first\":false,\"even\":false,\"last\":false},{\"index\":10,\"value\":{\"title\":\"Which network providers offer 5G service?\",\"descriptionData\":{\"items\":[{\"index\":0,\"value\":\"<p>\\n\\tAT&T, Boost Mobile, T-Mobile, and Verizon are the national wireless carriers for iPhone in the United States, and they all offer 5G service. iPhone 15, iPhone 16e, iPhone 16, and iPhone 16 Pro are 5G capable.
